content.description: Stand start on the positive ledge. Do a tough mantel.
content.location: This is on the right-most side of the Rufio Boulder.

content.description:
An extension of Peter Pan. 

  Start as for Tink. Gather your fairy dust as you traverse the ledge into Rufio, then make then leap into Wendy via Peter Pan. Don't punt as you make the awkward mantle up Wendy!
content.location: This is on the Rufio Boulder.

content.description: Start with a left hand sidepull and right hand in a 2.5 finger pocket. Go up to the horizontal crack, then move your right hand to a gaston on a bulge, then top out to the left. Awesome climb!
content.location: This is on the right side of the Neverland Crag. It is the left-most climb on the Rufio Boulder.

content.description: This is the low start to Captain Hook: start on the orange rail just left of the left-hand start hold of Captain Hook, then power through the bottom to finish up Captain Hook.
content.location: This is on the left-most side of the Neverland Crag.

content.description:
This is contrived but still quite fun. Start on a low jug. Make a big move to another great jug. Make another huge move to some OK holds up top, and mantel. Avoid the jug block on the topout ledge - it moves and could kill someone if it were dislodged.

 The rock on the left side of the chimney and the rock on the right side of the crack to the right of this climb (see the photo) are off.

 Downclimb the chimney just to the left.

 I'm sure this problem has been done before. Let me know if you have the name or FA info.
content.location: It is on the left side of Neverland Crag, immediately to the right of Captain Hook.

content.description: Start as for Rufio, then traverse the ledge into Tink. Finish up Tink.
Start on a sloping edge. Gain the ledge, then fire up left to an okay crimp on the rail near the top. Slap your right hand far back on the top, and muscle up the topout!
content.location: This is all the way to the right on the Neverland Crag, in the middle of the Rufio Boulder.

content.description:
Start on the ledge of Rufio, then dyno into the starting ledge of Wendy. Finish up Wendy. 

  The foot ledge of Wendy is off for the dyno. Using the foot ledge of Wendy for the start is a height-dependent variation called Peter Banning. 

  Starting from Tink is called Welcome to Neverland and is a blast if you've already done Peter Pan. There is no difference in grade ... maybe a bit more solid at V5.
Start as for Peter Pan, but use the foot ledge of Wendy to contort yourself past the dyno without jumping. It is height-dependent at around 5'9" . . otherwise it is significantly harder.

Start on a slopey (but juggy) rail, make a big move to a great hold, get other hand in a level horizontal crack, and cross into a jug, jug haul. Exit stage left, and walk the plank to dismount at Captain Hook. The first move is the crux. The stacked boulders to the right of the vertical seam are off!
content.location: It is immediately to the right of Captain Hook, towards the left side of Neverland Crag.

content.description: This is basically Welcome To Neverland backwards. Start on the ledge for Wendy, make a big span move left, reel it in, and ride the break to finish for Tink. It felt a touch easier than the Welcome to Neverland variation.
content.location: It is on the far right side on the Neverland Crag.

content.description: Start low on a jug in the middle of the face. Traverse low and left into the start of Captain Hook. Finish by climbing Captain Hook. This adds some fun opening moves into Captain Hook but makes the crux easier for meÂ
content.location: It climbs the center of Neverland Crag.

content.description: Start as for Tink, but finish as for Rufio.
content.location: This is on the left-most side of the Rufio Boulder.

content.description:
Start on the left hand side-pull and the polished right-facing arete. Summon your inner Hook and find your way to the slot, then figure out a way to the top. 

  The broken blocks to the right are off.
content.location: This is almost all the way to the left on the Neverland Crag.

content.description: Use the same start as Starkey, then go out right into a kneebar. The crux is about halfway through the problem when you are getting out of the kneebar.
content.location: It starts in the same spot as Starkey.

climbs.name: All My Ex-Boyfriends Are Peter Pan

content.description: Start standing on a jug at chest height, and work right along a jug rail before making a big move to a crimp used as a left hand hold on Captain Hook. Match on the crimp, and then top out as for Captain Hook. The grade is a guess, it could be easier or harder.
content.location: It is on the left side of the same rock as Captain Hook and Tick-Tock. The beginning has a fair amount of lichen. We scrubbed just as much as we needed.

content.description: The Neverland Crag is Southeast-facing; it gets sun in the morning and shade by the early afternoon.
